task.description: 设计一种在25度下能够尽可能多溶解电极材料中贵金属的5组分DES溶剂

components.name: Choline chloride
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond acceptor and structural backbone

components.name: Ethylene glycol
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond donor with low viscosity and good coordination ability

components.name: Glycerol
components.function: Secondary hydrogen bond donor enhancing metal complexation and solubility via multiple hydroxyl groups

components.name: Urea
components.function: Amide-based donor promoting deep eutectic formation through N–H⋯O bonding and mild reductive stabilization

components.name: ZnCl₂
components.function: Lewis acidic promoter enabling oxidative dissolution of noble metals via Zn²⁺/Cl⁻ coordination

reasoning: This five-component DES leverages multiple hydrogen bond donors (EG, glycerol, urea) to create a strong, interconnected H-bond network that depresses the melting point below 25°C while maintaining fluidity. The equimolar ZnCl₂ (vs. 0.5 in prior work) increases Lewis acidity, enhancing oxidative dissolution capacity for noble metals. Incorporating three distinct HBDs allows synergistic tuning of polarity, donor strength, and metal-coordination capability, which is critical for dissolving otherwise inert noble metals at ambient temperature.

components.function: Secondary hydrogen bond donor enhancing metal complexation and solubility via multiple hydroxyl groups

components.name: ZnCl₂

final_result.reasoning: This five-component DES leverages multiple hydrogen bond donors (EG, glycerol, urea) to create a strong, interconnected H-bond network that depresses the melting point below 25°C while maintaining fluidity. The equimolar ZnCl₂ (vs. 0.5 in prior work) increases Lewis acidity, enhancing oxidative dissolution capacity for noble metals. Incorporating three distinct HBDs allows synergistic tuning of polarity, donor strength, and metal-coordination capability, which is critical for dissolving otherwise inert noble metals at ambient temperature.
supporting_evidence: Experience 1 shows ChCl:EG:Gly:Urea:ZnCl₂ (1:2:1:1:0.5) forms a liquid DES at 25°C with 1.0 g/L noble metal solubility.
Experience 2 confirms that combining urea and polyols (EG, glycerol) enables stable 5-component DES formation via cooperative H-bonding.
Experience 3 indicates that 0.5 molar ZnCl₂ limits solubility, suggesting higher ratios (e.g., 1.0) may improve performance.
Literature reports show ZnCl₂-rich DES systems (e.g., Reline analogs with added ZnCl₂) enhance Au/Pt dissolution via chloro-complexation and oxidation.
final_result.synergy_explanation: Choline chloride and urea form a classic Reline-type H-bond network, while ethylene glycol and glycerol reduce viscosity and provide additional coordination sites for metal ions. Glycerol’s triol structure enhances solvation shell stability around dissolved noble metal species. Urea stabilizes transient oxidized metal states through dipole interactions, while ZnCl₂ at 1:1 ratio provides sufficient Cl⁻ ligands and Lewis acidity to drive oxidative dissolution—synergistically enabling higher noble metal solubility than lower-ZnCl₂ formulations.
memories_used: ChCl:EG:Gly:Urea:ZnCl₂ (1:2:1:1:0.5) Achieves 1.0 g/L Noble Metal Solubility at 25°C
Urea- and Polyol-Based HBDs Enable 5-Component DES Formation at 25°C
ZnCl₂ Addition (0.5 Molar Ratio) Insufficient for High Noble Metal Solubility in ChCl-Based DES
